boat.construction_details: Carvel construction with teak planks on steamed rock elm and grown oak frames.
boat.full_description:
Espanola may have originally been built for the King of Spain. In 1912 she was bought by H M Wright, founder and first commodore of the Irish Cruising Club. She remained in Ireland until 1956 when she was moved to England having several owners over the years.

She is now a gaff yawl based in Preston.
boat.name: Espanola
boat.short_description: Originally named Irene II, Espanola was built in 1902 by S F Bond of Birkenhead, rigged as a gaff cutter.
